private_information: You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You operate with full observability of the pegs and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to achieve the specified goal configuration by producing a legal, ordered list of primitive moves for your controllable disks only.

private_information: You may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
You operate with full observability of the pegs and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to achieve the specified goal configuration by producing a legal, ordered list of primitive moves for your controllable disks only.

private_information: You coordinate planning between two agents with disjoint move permissions.
You must return a final ordered list of primitive moves and also produce a PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver modeling agents, pegs, disks, and legal moves.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals, ensure consistency with auditor feedback, finalize the global plan, then produce a PDDL domain and problem achieving the target configuration.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across the entire move sequence.
Enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent-specific permissions; do not allow bookkeeping shortcuts or token accounting; only real moves are permitted.
Verify that the plan transforms the initial state into the goal state.
consistency_auditor.goal: Validate that proposed moves respect size constraints, peg availability, agent permissions, and produce the goal state from the initial state without contradictions.

public_information: Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the topmost disk on any peg may be moved; never place a larger disk onto a smaller disk; pegs are {left, middle, right}.
Disk sizes ascending A (smallest) to O (largest).
Agent permissions: agent_1 may move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 may move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) B, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) D; right peg has (top→bottom) A, C.
Primitive move format: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and may only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information to propose an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that only moves disks you are permitted to move and that contributes to achieving the goal configuration; do not emit PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and may only move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information to propose an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that only moves disks you are permitted to move and that contributes to achieving the goal configuration; if no moves are necessary, return an empty list with a brief justification; do not emit PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed moves and enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions without allowing bookkeeping shortcuts.
audit.prompt: Validate the combined move lists for rule compliance, agent permissions, and that they transform the initial state into the goal state; if compliant, return 'APPROVED' and the normalized, merged ordered list; otherwise, return 'REJECTED' with precise, actionable corrections.

integrate_moves.system_prompt: You coordinate multi-agent plans and produce a single, globally valid ordered list of primitive moves.
integrate_moves.prompt: Integrate the agents' move proposals, adopt any auditor corrections, and output the final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agents distinct via a typed agent parameter and permission predicates.
pddl.prompt: Produce a classical PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver that models Tower of Hanoi with three pegs, disks A..O (A smallest), agents agent_1 and agent_2 with move permissions encoded via a predicate such as can-move ?ag ?d, and legal move constraints (one disk at a time, only top disk movable, no larger on smaller). The initial state is: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle empty; right empty. The goal state is: left peg has (top→bottom) B, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) D; right peg has (top→bottom) A, C. Include typed objects for agents, disks, and pegs; predicates to represent on, on-peg, clear, top, smaller, can-move; and an action move with an agent parameter constrained by can-move. Ensure the generated PDDL is self-contained and solvable by FastDownward.
